> If at all possible, make your unit tests single threaded.
> Use mock objects for listeners ( http://www.jmock.org ).
> If your test really has to be multithreaded, use the util.concurrent 
> channel classes (now part of java 5) to post events back to the 
> testing thread where you can make assertions.
> Don't use Thread.sleep. That would make your tests slow and fragile.

At the risk of repeating myself, could you give a quick example of a 
multi-threaded test using util.concurrent?  Thanks,

    David Saff
